title: The Restless Flock
description: The colony of Canopy-Bats that roosts in the High Forest's upper branches and pollinates the forest's medicinal plants has been behaving erratically — flying in daylight, refusing to roost, and appearing to flee from a specific section of the western canopy. Forest Keeper Vael wants to know why.

turns.narrative: You enter the western section Vael indicated. The canopy is strangely quiet — no bird calls, no insect sounds. The Canopy-Bats are nowhere to be seen. But a faint vibration in the tree trunks is perceptible when you press your palm flat against the bark.
turns.choice_a: Follow the vibration to its source deeper in the western section
turns.consequence_a: The vibration intensifies as you move west. You find a geothermal micro-fissure in the forest floor, newly opened, emitting a low-frequency hum that only animals can properly hear.
turns.choice_b: Climb into the upper canopy to search for displaced bats and evidence of what disturbed them
turns.consequence_b: Sixty feet up you find dozens of bats huddled on the outermost branches, as far from the west as possible. Their echolocation is clearly being disrupted.

turns.narrative: The micro-fissure is the source. The low-frequency hum is distressing the bats and other wildlife. Left alone it may widen into a proper vent — which would alter the forest floor ecology significantly.
turns.choice_a: Seal the fissure using packed clay and Vael's emergency repair kit
turns.consequence_a: A careful two-hour job. The fissure is sealed. The hum stops within an hour.
turns.choice_b: Report the fissure to the Ridge Authority's geological team for a proper assessment
turns.consequence_b: The geological team arrives the next morning. Their assessment confirms the fissure can be safely sealed.

turns.narrative: The bats return to their roost within a day. Vael wants to monitor the fissure site going forward.
turns.choice_a: Place visible marker stakes around the fissure site for ongoing monitoring
turns.consequence_a: Marker stakes are set. Vael schedules monthly inspections.
turns.choice_b: Recommend the Ridge Authority include the High Forest in their routine geological survey circuit
turns.consequence_b: The survey circuit is extended to include the forest. Future fissures will be caught much earlier.

fissure_sealed.description: Fissure sealed. Bats returned to roost.

survey_extended.description: Ridge geological survey extended to forest.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Fissure sealed. Bats returned to roost.
